comment: Complained about not being full time,not getting paid enough&gave us so much work. Workload felt like 3 classes. No clear grading, says he'll give you an A if "he likes it"?? A girl in my class had someone die &told her she better get to class or her participation grade is going to go down. "I dont get paid enough to be accessible outside of class"

Professor Thompson is really helpful and hilarious. If you need help, let him know, and he'll give you a demonstration. Gets permission before drawing on your work. Can be a little slow with grading, but he'll let you know how you're doing. Sometimes his criteria are a little confusing and occasionally change, but he takes student feedback well.

Didnt know anything about fine art/life drawing before drawing 1, turns out to be a very in depth look at forms and textures and whatnot. be prepared to draw alot of still-life, and to spend alot of time on it. He can be a lil tired at times, but wasnt really a bad prof at all, just pay attention and practice a lot outside of class.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things

comment: I took Professor Thompsons class for Drawing I over the summer. I think he was on summer vacation and forgot he was teaching a class. Wishing I picked a different teacher. Did not put one grade in the entire semester, absolutely no help and little to no explanation on projects. At a disadvantage going into Drawing II.

Pros: Amazingly knowledgeable about art (technical skill) and willing to help. Really detailed feedback on assignments and plenty of opportunities to ask for help if youre confused. Does draw on your work, but only to show what hes trying to describe when asked questions Con: Really slow grader (its November and we dont have any grades in)
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Good: flexible turn in dates, good critiques. Bad: Unclear grading criteria. Doesn't consider 'effort', which SUCKS b/c those who're just starting to draw WILL be compared to those who've been drawing their whole lives. SLOW GRADER. If you ask for help he just takes over the drawing which makes it hard to learn/improve. Poor hygiene.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Thompson is an awesome professor. I took him for Drawing I and II. He makes class fun, and he's super laid back. You'll also leave the class with great drawing skills. Definitely recommend!!

He is a really fun teacher with a unique taste in music. If you do all of your work and don't procrastinate (it's obvious if you do) then you will be fine regardless of natural talent. He accounts for how well you've improved over the semester to give your final grade. Make sure you have all needed materials. I would take his class again!
Thompson was great at setting concrete deadlines and sticking to them. While I wish he would be a little less grouchy, I would absolutely take his class again.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: He tries way too hard to be the cool teacher. Does not explain grading criteria or have rubric. Unprofessional and wants high level of technicality when its only Drawing 1.
He is just really unprofessional and that is not always a good thing. No clear grading criteria

Suprisingly close minded, hes one of those teachers that don't respect your personal creativity but wants you to do it his way and it's not always made clear what he wants when it came to an actual studio course.
Very nice and funny. Easy going and makes class fun.

Class summary: "Thanks for bringing up my GPA!" GREAT personality, criteria and expectations of students are clearcut! Study guides are identical to tests... 2 museum visits and 4 group assignments-- all in which required one page (typed or hand-written) reviewanalysis. EASY A! and gained useful knowledge of visual art! The best!
Very nice and fun. Make sure you go to class, there are group assignments and 2 museum visits.

Great teacher! Knows what he is talking about. Almost all classes are power points straight from  chapters in the book. Tests are easy, exactly the review and he gives you the answers.  Extra credit is given and used towards tests. He plays a good amount of art documentaries which are very interesting. Would definitely recommend him!

I loved him!!! I had him for drawing 1. He lets you do your own thing and gives good feedback when needed. He is really fun and easy going! Participation is important and you need to show up to pass. Overall I thought he was a great teacher and would take his class again.
